channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: U.S. group travels to Syria in search of missing reporter Austin Tice
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Ellen Nakashima, Dan Lamothe
item.description: The fall of President Bashar al-Assad has revived hopes that Austin Tice, a journalist abducted while covering Syria’s civil war, will be found alive.

item.title: Mazen al-Hamada, symbol of Syrian regime’s brutality, confirmed dead
item.dc:creator: Liz Sly
item.description: His body was found with about 40 others wrapped in bloody sheets and dumped at a military hospital outside Damascus.

item.title: In Syria’s former ‘slaughterhouse,’ a desperate hunt for the disappeared
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Families searching Sednaya prison feared that they would not learn the fate of their missing loved ones — and that so much of what happened there may never be known.

item.title: Israel expands airstrikes across Syria amid widening power vacuum
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Lior Soroka

item.title: Live Briefing: U.S. would recognize a Syrian government that comes from inclusive process, Blinken says
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Annabelle Timsit, Bryan Pietsch, Kelsey Baker, Sammy Westfall, Michael Birnbaum
item.description: The Israeli strikes, days after Bashar al-Assad’s fall, targeted Syrian military facilities, including a possible chemical weapons facility, said two Western officials.

item.title: Analysis: Iran reels from ‘tectonic shift’ in Middle East amid scramble for Syria
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor

item.title: Israel expands airstrikes across Syria amid widening power vacuum
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Lior Soroka
item.description: The Israeli military said it had carried out 350 strikes on Syrian territory since Sunday, destroying weapons sites and effectively eliminating the Syrian navy.

item.title: Iran reels from ‘tectonic shift’ in Middle East amid scramble for Syria
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: As Iran deals with the strategic setback of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad’s ouster, a vicious cycle of confrontation and escalation could already be in motion.

item.title: About 26 killed in strike in Beit Hanoun in north Gaza, rescue workers say
item.dc:creator: Hajar Harb, Miriam Berger

item.title: Russia’s elite sound the alarm on the economy amid high interest rates
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton
item.description: Squeezed by Western sanctions and soaring interest rates, Russia’s businesses fear bankruptcies as President Vladimir Putin pushes ahead with the Ukraine war.

item.title: Netanyahu takes the stand in his corruption trial. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s court appearance comes against the backdrop of war in Gaza, regime collapse in Syria and a tenuous ceasefire in Lebanon.

item.title: China reveals its playbook for dealing with impending Trump trade war
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop, Vic Chiang
item.description: Beijing is responding to Biden administration actions decisively and swiftly — a warning to Donald Trump that it will play hardball this time, analysts say.

item.title: Netanyahu takes the stand in his corruption trial as supporters, critics gather outside
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Lior Soroka

item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris

item.title: U.S. scrambles to contain Syrian chaos
item.dc:creator: Karen DeYoung, Michael Birnbaum, Missy Ryan
item.description: The sudden rebel offensive leading to the collapse of Assad’s government and military forces has left governments around the world reeling.

item.title: Biden special envoy for hostages is in Beirut in search of Austin Tice
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, Michael Birnbaum
item.description: Senior administration officials have no confirmed evidence that the imprisoned journalist is alive, but the State Department “will leave no stone unturned.”

item.title: Israeli troops move swiftly into Syrian territory after rebel takeover
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Steve Hendrix
item.description: Israel defended its actions as defensive as nature, securing the country from future attacks, while Arab countries said they amounted to an illegal occupation.

item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Suzan Haidamous, Rachel Pannett, Niha Masih, Leo Sands, Annabelle Timsit, Kelsey Baker, Sammy Westfall

item.dc:creator: Widlore Mérancourt, Matthew Brown

item.title: Joy, fear and confusion in Damascus as Syrians welcome life after Assad
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Rapturous celebrations in the streets of the capital were tempered by trepidation over whether the city’s new rebel caretakers could deliver a better future.

item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Júlia Ledur

item.title: An ousted Assad lands in Moscow, Russian outlet says; Iran says Assad was ‘stunned’ by his army’s collapse
